headline: Kevin McCarthy caught on tape: Trump won't forgive him this time
author: Heather Digby Parton
sentences: Excerpts of the latest tell-all book about Donald Trump's tumultuous final days in the White House as he attempted to execute his coup d'etat, this one by New York Times reporters Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns, made the rounds on Thursday and contained some new juicy details about the doings of then-Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., and McCarthy during that period.

The book, entitled "This Will Not Pass: Trump, Biden and the Battle for America's Future," reveals McConnell making delightful comments like, "The Democrats are going to take care of the son of a bitch for us," referring to the impending impeachment over the events of January 6th about which he reasonably said, "If this isn't impeachable, I don't know what is."

McConnell said as much on the floor of the Senate and despite his unprincipled commitment to vote for Trump in 2024 should he be the nominee, McConnell has made no secret of his loathing for Trump — a loathing that is fully reciprocated by the man who calls McConnell "Old Crow" and urges every Senate candidate to vote against him for Senate leader.

A month before Donald Trump clinched the Republican nomination, one of his closest allies in Congress — House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy — made a politically explosive assertion in a private conversation on Capitol Hill with his fellow GOP leaders: that Trump could be the beneficiary of payments from Russian President Vladimir Putin.
